result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Krystal J Baron

records.addlTxt: Court entered not guilt plea for defendant. Motions due 20 days. Bail continued.

Defendant Krystal J Baron in court.  Attorney Glenn Edward Avena in court for Krystal J Baron. Prosecuting attorney Timothy Robert Verhoff in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Avena requests possible future witness D. B. be sequestered. Atty Verhoff objects. Court denies request. Witness C. B. duly sworn and testified. Atty Verhoff with direct. Witness identified DE in the courtroom. Atty Avena with cross. State moves for bindover, reserves argument. Atty Avena objects, gives argument against bindover. Court finds probable cause for bindover to branch. DE waived reading of information.

11:32 AM Defendant Krystal J Baron in court.  Attorney Glenn Edward Avena in court for Krystal J Baron.  Attorney Tim Verhoff in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim appeared by phone means. 

State speaks to officer/witness being deceased, gives request to hold hearing by zoom or for setover. Atty. Avena responds, objects to holding preliminary hearing by zoom. Court sets hearing over to afternoon for witness to appear in person.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with CMB. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 7

8:37 AM Defendant Krystal J Baron in court.  Attorney Eric James Caudill in court for Krystal J Baron.  Prosecuting attorney Tomas Fernando Valerio in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 3, 2022 at 10:30 am.
